(B) He told me to give him food, please.
(C) He said to me that give him food please.
(D) He requested me that give me some food
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is option 1) i.e., ' He requested me to give him some food.'

Key Points

  • The given sentence is an imperative sentence. 
  • While changing the narration of an imperative sentence, we need to follow these steps
    • If the sentence is a request (as  the given sentence since it uses 'please) we make the following changes-
    • The reporting verb said is changed into requested. 
    • The first person 'me' will be changed into 'him'. 
    • The tense of the given sentence is present tense (give) which remains unchanged in the indirect sentence. 
    • The verb to is added before the verb of the reported speech (give). 
  • Eventually, we will get the final sentence- " He requested me to give him some food."

quiz.text: Directions: What is the antonym of the word FICKLE?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'Loyal.'

Key Points

  • The given word 'Fickle' means always changing your mind or your feelings so you cannot be trusted. (मत, भावनाएँ आदि निरंतर बदलते हुए और इसलिए अविश्‍वसनीय; अस्थिरमति, चंचल)
    • Example: Because Ranbir is such a fickle man, he will probably never settle down with one woman.
  • ​Let's see the meaning of other given options:-
    • 'Loyal' means (used about a person) not changing in your friendship or beliefs. (निष्‍ठावान व्‍यक्ति)
      • Example: We should be loyal to our country.
    • 'Miser' means a person who loves to have a lot of money but hates to spend it. (कंजूस, कृपण)
      • Example: My uncle is a miser who complains about having to pay for anything.
    • 'Rebel' means a person who fights against his or her country’s government because he/she wants things to change. (राजद्रोही; सत्ता-विरोधी व्‍यक्ति)
      • Example: If you rebel against the government, you could be considered a traitor to your country.
    • 'Fool' means a person who is silly or who acts in a silly way. (मूर्ख या मूर्खता का आचरण करने वाला व्‍यक्ति; बेवक़ूफ़)
      • Example: Stop acting like a fool, and take that toilet seat off your head.
         

Hence, the correct answer is option 1.

Additional Information

  • The antonyms of the word 'Fickle' are "loyal, reliable, faithful".
  • The synonyms of the word 'Fickle' are "disloyal, unreliable, unfaithful".

quiz.text:
Direction: Select the word with correct spelling for filling in the blanks in the following sentences.

A _______ disease in one that can be passed on by physical contact.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'contagious'.

Key Points

  • Let's explore the given options:
    • Contagious - Used about a disease that you can get by touching somebody/something.
    • Contiguous - In contact with something; next to each other.It means two things that are connected.
    • Conteguous - There is no such word in English or we can say that there is some spelling mistake in this word.
    • Conteeguous - There is no such word in English or we can say that there is some spelling mistake in this word.
  • In the given question we are talking about the disease that can be passed from one person to another by touching.
  • Thus, option 1 is the correct option out of the other given options.

 

Hence, the correct sentence is: A contagious disease in one that can be passed on by physical contact.

Additional Information

  • Let's look at the synonyms and antonyms of the given word:
    • Synonyms - Catching, pestilent, transmissible, etc.
    • Antonyms - Noninfectious, noncommunicable, etc.

  • Contiguous is also right but it cannot be the answer of the given question. It means two things that are connected or touching along one side.
  • Example:
    • Contiguous countries should share good political relations.

quiz.text:
Turning the clock back to our glory days is fruitless. We’ve to work harder and smarter in the present.

What does 'turn the clock back' mean?
options: (A) to be active without achieving any worthwhile result
(D) change the way one behaves with others from good to bad.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'return to an earlier period of time'.

Key Points

  • 'Turn the clock back' is an idiom.
  • An idiom is a phrase or expression that has a meaning that in most cases cannot be deduced directly from the individual words in that phrase or expression. 
    • For eg.- Chow Down - Meaning: To eat something, usually quickly or vigorously.
  • We can gather from the given statement that to turn the clock back means to go to an earlier period of time.
  • Hence, option 2 is the correct answer.

Additional Information

  • Let's look at the remaining options.
    • Idiom Meaning Example Sentence
      Run around in circles
      		 To be active without achieving any worthwhile result I had a tendency to run around in circles getting more and more worked up.
      Against the clock
      		 In a great hurry With only half the syllabus studied, I raced against the clock to be ready for the exam on Monday.
      Change tune
      		 Change the way one behaves with others from good to bad He was against the idea to start with, but he soon changed his tune when he realized how much money he'd get.

quiz.text:
Direction: A sentence / a part of the sentence is underlined. Four alternatives are given to the underlined part which will improve/correct the sentence. Choose the right option to correct the sentence.

As a schoolgirl, I often go to school on foot.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'went'.

Key points 

  • The given sentence is an action that is over.
  • It is thus in the simple past tense.
  • The structure is: 
    • Sub + V2 + obj.
  • We will thus replace the underlined word 'go' with its 'v2' form i.e. 'went'.

The correct sentence will be: As a schoolgirl, I often went to school on foot.

  • Hence, option 1 is the correct answer.

Additional Information

  • If the sentence starts with 'It's time', 'It's high time' or 'It's about time' and it is followed by a subject, the verb that will follow the subject will be in second (V2).
    • For eg.- It's time you cleaned.

quiz.text:
Direction: In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Fill in the blanks with the help of the alternatives given. Select the most appropriate option for each blank.

The ancient Sanskrit text boasts of various animal stories in verse and prose. (1)______ all these centuries, many authors and publishers worked hard to make these fables accessible and readable by a layman. The grand assortment (2)_____ extraordinary tales that are liked, perhaps even loved (3)_____ people of every age group. The Panchatantra is the best guide to (4)_____ moral values in children since each (5)_____ has a moral lesson at its end.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 1.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'During'.

Key Points

Let us look into the meaning of the given options:

  • Ahead - further forward in space; in the line of one's forward motion.
  • During - throughout the course or duration of (a period of time).
  • Before - during the period of time preceding a particular event or time.
  • For -  for the reason that: on this ground: because.
  • The given blank needs a word that will talk about the ongoing time period in which many authors and publishers worked.
  • Thus, During is the best fit for the given blank.
  • This makes option 2 the correct answer.

The complete passage is: The ancient Sanskrit text boasts of various animal stories in verse and prose. (1) During all these centuries, many authors and publishers worked hard to make these fables accessible and readable by a layman. The grand assortment (2) Has extraordinary tales that are liked, perhaps even loved (3) By people of every age group. The Panchatantra is the best guide to (4) Enroot moral values in children since each (5) Tale has a moral lesson at its end.

Additional Information

Let's discuss the other options in sentences:

  • Ahead - 'The main road is 'ahead'.
  • Before - 'My struggle day had ended 2 years before'.
  • For - 'I came here for dinner'.

quiz.text:
Direction: In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Fill in the blanks with the help of the alternatives given. Select the most appropriate option for each blank.

The ancient Sanskrit text boasts of various animal stories in verse and prose. (1)______ all these centuries, many authors and publishers worked hard to make these fables accessible and readable by a layman. The grand assortment (2)_____ extraordinary tales that are liked, perhaps even loved (3)_____ people of every age group. The Panchatantra is the best guide to (4)_____ moral values in children since each (5)_____ has a moral lesson at its end.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 2.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'Has'.

Key Points 

Let us look into the meaning of the given options:

  • Has - It is a verb used in the present perfect tense ( subject + has + V3 ) used in the singular sense.
  • Have - It is a verb used in the present perfect tense ( subject + have + V3 ) used in the plural sense.
  • Were - It is used in the second person singular and plural (you, your, yours) and first and third person plural (we, they).
  • Are - It is a verb used in the present continuous tense ( subject + V1 + ing ) used in the plural sense.
  • The given blank needs a singular verb, and has is the only verb given in options that is used with a singular noun.
  • Thus, Has is the best fit for the given blank.
  • This makes option 1 the correct answer.

The complete passage is: The ancient Sanskrit text boasts of various animal stories in verse and prose. (1) During all these centuries, many authors and publishers worked hard to make these fables accessible and readable by a layman. The grand assortment (2) Has extraordinary tales that are liked, perhaps even loved (3) By people of every age group. The Panchatantra is the best guide to (4) Enroot moral values in children since each (5) Tale has a moral lesson at its end.

Additional Information 

Let's discuss the other options in sentences:

  • Have - 'They have a new bike'.
  • Were - 'We all wish that we were rich'.
  • Are - 'The companies are working hard to capture the market'.

quiz.text:
Direction: In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Fill in the blanks with the help of the alternatives given. Select the most appropriate option for each blank.

The ancient Sanskrit text boasts of various animal stories in verse and prose. (1)______ all these centuries, many authors and publishers worked hard to make these fables accessible and readable by a layman. The grand assortment (2)_____ extraordinary tales that are liked, perhaps even loved (3)_____ people of every age group. The Panchatantra is the best guide to (4)_____ moral values in children since each (5)_____ has a moral lesson at its end.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 3.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'By'.

Key Points 

Let us look into the meaning of the given options:

  • In - it is used to indicate a direction, month, year, duration.
  • On - physically in contact with and supported by (a surface).
  • For -  for the reason that: on this ground: because.
  • By -  to identify the agent, after passive voice, to the extent.
  • In the given blank we need a preposition to denote an agent or mean.
  • Thus, By is the best fit for the given blank.
  • This makes option 4 the correct answer.

The complete passage is: The ancient Sanskrit text boasts of various animal stories in verse and prose. (1) During all these centuries, many authors and publishers worked hard to make these fables accessible and readable by a layman. The grand assortment (2) Has extraordinary tales that are liked, perhaps even loved (3) By people of every age group. The Panchatantra is the best guide to (4) Enroot moral values in children since each (5) Tale has a moral lesson at its end.

Additional Information 

Let's discuss the other options in sentences:

  • In - 'I am going in the north direction'.
  • On - 'Put that jug on the table'.
  • For - 'I came here for dinner'.

quiz.text:
Direction: In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Fill in the blanks with the help of the alternatives given. Select the most appropriate option for each blank.

The ancient Sanskrit text boasts of various animal stories in verse and prose. (1)______ all these centuries, many authors and publishers worked hard to make these fables accessible and readable by a layman. The grand assortment (2)_____ extraordinary tales that are liked, perhaps even loved (3)_____ people of every age group. The Panchatantra is the best guide to (4)_____ moral values in children since each (5)_____ has a moral lesson at its end.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 4.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'Enroot'.

Key Points 

Let us look into the meaning of the given options:

  • Decline - (typically of something regarded as good) become smaller, fewer, or less; decrease.
  • Halt - bring or come to an abrupt stop.
  • Enroot- establish, implant.
  • Lessen - make or become less; diminish.
  • The given blank needs a word that gives a sense of establishing something or creating something.
  • Thus, Enroot is the best fit for the given blank.
  • This makes option 3 the correct answer.

The complete passage is: The ancient Sanskrit text boasts of various animal stories in verse and prose. (1) During all these centuries, many authors and publishers worked hard to make these fables accessible and readable by a layman. The grand assortment (2) Has extraordinary tales that are liked, perhaps even loved (3) By people of every age group. The Panchatantra is the best guide to (4) Enroot moral values in children since each (5) Tale has a moral lesson at its end.

Additional Information 

Let's discuss the other options in sentences:

  • Decline - 'The inflation rate continues to decline'.
  • Halt  - 'He decided to call a halt to all further action'.
  • Lessen - 'The years have lessened the gap in age between you and me'.

quiz.text:
Direction: In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Fill in the blanks with the help of the alternatives given. Select the most appropriate option for each blank.

The ancient Sanskrit text boasts of various animal stories in verse and prose. (1)______ all these centuries, many authors and publishers worked hard to make these fables accessible and readable by a layman. The grand assortment (2)_____ extraordinary tales that are liked, perhaps even loved (3)_____ people of every age group. The Panchatantra is the best guide to (4)_____ moral values in children since each (5)_____ has a moral lesson at its end.

Select the most appropriate option to fill in blank number 5.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'Tale'.

Key Points 

Let us look into the meaning of the given options:

  • Elegy - (in modern literature) a poem of serious reflection, typically a lament for the dead.
  • Requiem - a musical composition setting parts of a requiem Mass, or of a similar character.
  • Tale - a fictitious or true narrative or story, especially one that is imaginatively recounted.
  • Poem - a piece of writing in which the expression of feelings and ideas is given intensity by particular attention to diction (sometimes involving rhyme), rhythm.
  • By the above points explained, it is clear that tale is the appropriate word for the blank.
  • Thus, tale is the best fit for the given blank.
  • This makes option 3 the correct answer.

The complete passage is: The ancient Sanskrit text boasts of various animal stories in verse and prose. (1) During all these centuries, many authors and publishers worked hard to make these fables accessible and readable by a layman. The grand assortment (2) Has extraordinary tales that are liked, perhaps even loved (3) By people of every age group. The Panchatantra is the best guide to (4) Enroot moral values in children since each (5) Tale has a moral lesson at its end.

Additional Information 

Let's discuss the other options in sentences:

  • Elegy - 'There is a loud sound of elegy on the roadside'.
  • Requiem - 'He designed the epic as a requiem for his wife'.
  • Poem - 'The moon is the important symbol in the poem'.

quiz.text:
A sentence has been given in Active/Passive Voice. Out of the four alternatives suggested, select one which best expresses the same sentence in Passive/Active Voice.

Rohan saw John shopping at the market.
options: (A) John is seen shopping at the market by Rohan.
(B) John was seen shopping at the market by Rohan.
(C) John was being seen shopping at the market by Rohan.
(D) John is being seen shopping at the market by Rohan.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is- 'John was seen shopping at the market by Rohan.' Key Points

  •  General formula: Object + was/were + V3 + by + subject.
  • The sentence is of past indefinite tense.
  • The verb in the sentence is 'shopping'.
  • The given sentence is in Active Voice, the sentence looks like it is of continuous tense but it is not
  • The reporting of the sentence shows it is of past activity as the activity has been over.

​Thus the correct sentence in the Passive Voice is- 'John was seen shopping at the market by Rohan. '

Additional Information

  • In Past Indefinite Tense, we use just 2nd form of Verb with He, She, It, I, We, You, They, and Name/Names.
  • While forming the question in Past Indefinite Tense, we insert Did in the beginning. 
  • When we insert Did in the beginning, the verb (which is in 2nd form) changes into the first form.
    • Example: Active: Did you make a noise?.
                      Passive: Was a noise made by you?

quiz.text:
'The manager is going to lay off some employees this weekend.'

The underline phrasal verb means:
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'to terminate the service of'

Key Points

  • From the given sentence we can understand that the manager is going to end the service of some employees.
  • Thus we can infer from the line that to lay off must mean to terminate someone's service.
  • Hence, option 3 is the correct answer.

Additional Information

  •  A phrasal verb is an idiomatic phrase consisting of a verb and another element, typically either an adverb, as in break down, or a preposition.
    for eg- look after, get away with etc.
     

The correct answer- To terminate service of

quiz.text:
In the following question, four pairs of words are given. Find the word pair which have dissimilar meaning from the options given below:

(A) Bias - Prejudice
(B) Authentic - Genuine
(C) Vertical - Upright
(D) Mature - Childish
quiz.solution:
Here the correct answer is D.

Key Points

  • Let's look at the meaning of the words given as correct answer -
    • Mature - (especially of a young person) having reached a stage of mental or emotional development characteristic of an adult.
    • Example -  Ram is very mature for his age.
    • Childish - silly and immature.
    • Example  - It's time you gave up your childish behaviour.
  • After looking at the meanings of the above-given words, it is clear that both the words have dissimilar meanings.
  • Thus, the correct answer is Option 4.

Additional Information

  • Let's look at the meaning of the other words given in options:-
    • Bias - inclination or prejudice for or against one person or group, especially in a way considered to be unfair.
    • Prejudice - preconceived opinion that is not based on reason or actual experience; dislike, hostility, or unjust behaviour deriving from preconceived and unfounded opinions.
    • Authentic - of undisputed origin and not a copy; genuine.
    • Genuine - truly what something is said to be; authentic.
    • Vertical - at right angles to a horizontal plane; in a direction, or having an alignment, such that the top is directly above the bottom.
    • Upright - placed in a vertical position.

quiz.text:
Select the most appropriate word to fill in the blank.

Can you please ______ me in sorting out these files on my computer?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'assist'.

Key Points

  • The most appropriate word to fill in the given blank is 'assist'.
  • The word 'assist' means 'to help सहायता करना'.
  • If we 'assist' someone, we give them information, advice, or money. 
    • Example: The public is urgently requested to assist police in tracing this man.
  • Therefore, as per the points mentioned above, we find that the correct answer is Option 3.
    ​

Correct Sentence: Can you please assist me in sorting out these files on my computer?

Hinglish

  • दिए गए रिक्त स्थान को भरने के लिए सबसे उपयुक्त शब्द 'सहायता' है।
  • 'assist' शब्द का अर्थ है 'मदद करना'
  • अगर हम किसी की 'सहायता' करते हैं, तो हम उन्हें जानकारी, सलाह या पैसा देते हैं।
    • उदाहरण: The public is urgently requested to assist police in tracing this man.
  • इसलिए, ऊपर वर्णित बिंदुओं के अनुसार, हम पाते हैं कि सही उत्तर विकल्प 3 है।

Additional Information

  • Let's look at the meaning of other words:
Words Meaning
Abet encourage or assist (someone) to do something wrong, in particular, to commit a crime कुछ गलत करने के लिए (किसी को) प्रोत्साहित करना या सहायता करना, विशेष रूप से अपराध करने के लिए।
Hinder to make it more difficult for somebody/something to do something
व्‍यक्ति या वस्‍तु के लिए कठिनाई पैदा करना, किसी के काम में बाधा डालना
 Connive  to work secretly with somebody to do something that is wrong; to do nothing to stop somebody doing something wrong
गुप्‍त रीति से कोई ग़लत काम करना; किसी को ग़लत काम करने से न रोकना; ग़लत काम की अनदेखी करना

quiz.text:
Direction: Improve the underlined part.

The welfare of all people can be increased only if we use available human resources in the most efficient way.
options: (B) can be increased i.e. No improvement is required
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'can be increased i.e. No improvement is required'.

Key Points

  • The sentence is in the first conditional. It is used to talk about the result of an imagined future situation, when we believe the imagined situation is quite likely. The structure is:
    • If + present simple (conditional clause)
    • modal verb (shall/should/will/would/can/could/may/might) + V1 (main clause)
      • Ex: If the taxi doesn’t come soon, I’ll drive you myself.
  • In the given sentence, there is a condition to increase the welfare of all people and the conditional clause; i.e. if-clause is in present simple (use), therefore, 'can be increased' is the only possible structure.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is option 2).

Correct sentence: The welfare of all people can be increased only if we use available human resources in the most efficient way.

quiz.text:
Direction: In the following question there is a sentence in which some parts have been jumbled up. You are required to rearrange these parts which are labeled P, Q, R and S, to produce the correct sentence. Choose the correct sequence.

Payment for _______

P. system called foreign exchange

Q. through a

R. imports and exports

S. is made
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is- 'RSQP.'

Key Points

  • While arranging the parts of the passage given in options, we have to find some grammatical or contextual connections between them, so let’s find out.  
    • The opener will be R as it introduces the context of the paragraph.
    • After this, S will come as it is providing a helping verb to the subject.
    • After this, Q will come as it is connecting sentence to S.
    • P follows Q as it is providing a conclusion to the context.
  • ​​The correct sequence:​

R. imports and exports

S. is made

Q. through a

P. system called foreign exchange

Correct sentence: Payment for imports and exports is made through a system called foreign exchange.

Additional Information      
 

  • Steps for solving Para Jumbles:
    • Clues include pronouns, like he, she, it, this, that, these, those; adverbs like formally, really; article a, an and the; definers like actually, finally, another; connectors like but, yet, both, also and neither nor, or, however, nevertheless.
    • Now, with the help of clues, try to find out qualifier and qualified sentences, so that we can make pairs of qualified and qualifier sentences to eliminate the wrong choices given in the question.
    • After making pairs, start eliminating the wrong choices or options given in the question.
    • In case there is more than one choice, try to follow the sequence of sentences according to the occurrence of the events.

Hinglish    

  • विकल्पों में दिए गए गद्यांश के भागों को व्यवस्थित करते समय, हमें उनके बीच कुछ व्याकरणिक या प्रासंगिक संबंध खोजने होंगे, तो आइए जानें।
    • Opener, R होगा क्योंकि यह पैराग्राफ के संदर्भ का परिचय देता है।
    • इसके बाद, S आएगा क्योंकि यह विषय को सहायक क्रिया प्रदान कर रहा है।
    • इसके बाद Q आएगा क्योंकि यह वाक्य को S से जोड़ रहा है।
    • P, Q का अनुसरण करता है क्योंकि यह संदर्भ को निष्कर्ष प्रदान कर रहा है।

quiz.text: Which of the following prefixes can be used to form the opposite of the word 'regard'?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'Dis-'.

Key Points

  • A prefix is a word, letter, or number placed before another.
  • Antonyms are words that have contrasting, or opposite, meanings. 
  • In order to make the opposite of the word 'regard', we will use the prefix 'dis',  meaning “expressing negation”.
  • 'Disregard' means 'pay no attention to or ignore'.
    • For eg.-  She shows a blithe disregard for danger.
  • Hence, option 4 is the most appropriate choice.​​

Additional Information

  • Let's look at the following prefixes.
Word Meaning Example
Il-  not or no Illiteracy, Illogical, etc.
Un-

 denoting the absence of a quality or state.

 Unenergetic, Untrue etc.
Im- in, into, towards, or within  Impartial, Impatient, etc.

quiz.text: Directions: Out of the following options, choose the one which has no error. In these sentences, one word is incorrectly spelt in 3 sentences. Choose the one which is correct.
options: (A) December is the twelth month of the year.
(B) December is the twelfth month of the year.
(C) December is the twealth month of the year.
(D) December is the twelthe month of the year.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'December is the twelfth month of the year' i.e. this sentence has no error.

Key Points    

  • Let us explore the words in the options:-
    • Twelth: There is no such word in English or we can say that there is some spelling mistake in this word.
    • Twelfth: The correctly spelt word is 'Twelfth' and it means constituting number twelve in a sequence; 12th. (एक क्रम में संख्या बारह का गठन; बारहवें)
    • Twealth: There is no such word in English or we can say that there is some spelling mistake in this word.
    • Twelthe: There is no such word in English or we can say that there is some spelling mistake in this word.
       

Hence, the correct answer is option 2.

Additional Information

  • Example of 'Twelfth' in a sentence:
    • I am planning to leave on the twelfth of this month.

quiz.text:
Directions: Fill in the blanks in the following sentences with the help of options that follow.

Rohan has brought some magazines ______, you to read.
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is-'for'

Key Points

  • From the given options, 'for ' is the most appropriate answer to fill in the blank.
  • As we can understand from the sentence that Rohan has brought magazines which is basically for some purpose. 
  • For can be used in preposition and conjunction 
    • Use to indicate the use of something.
      • Example: I cooked food for you.
    • Use to the meaning of because of.
      • Example: we feel deeply sorry for such inconvenience.
    • Use to indicate time or duration
      • Example: This is all I have for today.
  • So option 2 is the most appropriate answer. As it fits with the context of the sentence.

the correct answer is: Rohan has brought some magazines for, you to read.

Additional Information

  •  Preposition: it is a word that connects nouns, pronouns, or phrases to other words that are there in the sentence.
    • Example: My mother is cooking for ten guests tonight.

quiz.text:
Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the given word.

Comfort
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is option 2) i.e., 'discontentment'.

Key Points

  •   Comfort is a noun that means a state of physical ease and freedom from pain or constraint. (आराम)
    • ​Example - There is room for four people to travel in comfort.
  • The meanings of the given options are as follows:- 
    • Happiness - the state of being happy. (ख़ुशी)
    • Discontentment - lack of contentment; dissatisfaction. (असंतोष)
    • Luxury - a state of great comfort or elegance, especially when involving great expense. (बहुत आराम या लालित्य की स्थिति, खासकर जब बहुत अधिक खर्च शामिल हो)
    • Enjoyment - the state or process of taking pleasure in something. (किसी चीज का आनंद लेने की अवस्था या प्रक्रिया)
  • From the above meanings, it is evident that discontentment is the correct antonym for the word comfort.

quiz.text: Select the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
quiz.solution:
The incorrect spelling is- Preshious.

Key Points

  • The correct spelling of the word is- Precious.
  • The meaning of the word is- of great value; not to be wasted or treated carelessly.
  • The synonyms of the word can be Valuable, rare, expensive, etc.

Hence, the correct answer is Option 1.

Additional Information

  • The rest of the words are absolutely correct. The meaning of the words is-
    • Plenary- unqualified; absolute.
    • Presentable- clean, smart, or decent enough to be seen in public.
    • Peaceful- free from disturbance; tranquil.

quiz.text:
It’s not that the management is not aware of few false bills here and there, but they don’t call it because it would expose many and stir up a hornet’s nest.

What does stirring up a hornet's nest mean?
options: (A) mixing the nest in water and stirring it
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is 'provoking trouble'.

Key Points

  • 'Stir up a hornet's nest' is an idiom.
  • An idiom is a phrase or expression that has a meaning that in most cases cannot be deduced directly from the individual words in that phrase or expression. 
    • For eg.- Upset someone’s applecart - Meaning: Doing something that causes a plan to go wrong.
  • We can gather from the given statement that to stir up a hornet's nest means to provoke trouble.
  • Hence, option 2 is the correct answer.

Additional Information

  • Hornets are the largest of the eusocial wasps and are similar in appearance to their close relatives yellowjackets.
    • For eg.-  He was stung by a hornet.

quiz.text:
Direction: Read the passage carefully and answer the given question.

In 1837 Louis Aggasiz, a young naturalist, had to suffer ridicule at the hands of geologists while trying to prove that the earth had gone through a number of ice ages. Then, for almost a century, the four-fold ice age scheme of the Alps (Wurm, Riss, Mindel and Gunz) given by Alberta Penck and E. B. Rucker in 1909 got so well entrenched in geology that most of the global evidence was forced to fit into this fourfold framework and nobody dared to think of more than four ice ages. Only recently have the data from sea-cores and deep ice cores revealed that, in the last 2 million years, the earth has witnessed 17-18 cold-warm oscillations rather than four, as believed earlier. More important was the realization that ice ages, were several times longer than the warm periods and that they could be triggered off even within a brief space of a century. The warm periods were normally only of a span of 10-15 thousand years. The portrait of an ice age is starkly gloomy. Vast areas of earth, including large areas of Europe, Canada, U.S.A and India: may come under a thick blanket of ice and the lower latitudes will be under the grip of droughts and famine. With the already mounting food and fuel crisis, the earth can ill-afford such a catastrophe.

Which among the following is not one of the four fold ice age scheme of the Alps?
quiz.solution:
The correct answer is Gonk.

Key Points

  • Refer to the line: Then, for almost a century, the four-fold ice age scheme of the Alps (Wurm, Riss, Mindel and Gunz) given by Alberta Penck and E. B. Rucker in 1909 got so well entrenched in geology that most of the global evidence was forced to fit into this fourfold framework and nobody dared to think of more than four ice ages. 
  • Upon the perusal of the above statement, it can be concluded that only Gonk is not among the four fold ice age scheme of the Alps.
  • All the other options are stated clearly in the given line.
  • Hence, option 4 is the correct answer choice.

quiz.text:
Direction: The following sentence has been divided into parts. One of them contains an error. Select the part that contains the error from the given options.

She used to share / a room with her sister, / but now she have / her own room.
quiz.solution:
The erroneous part is "but now she have"

Key Points

  • In option 3, the usage of 'have' is incorrect instead of this we need to use 'has'
  • According to grammar, whenever the subject of the sentence is singular then, we have to use a singular verb and whenever the subject is plural then we need to use a plural verb.
  • In the given sentence, the subject is "she" which is singular hence, we need to use "has"
  • Let's see an example-
    • She has never been a friend of ours.

So the correct sentence is- She used to share a room with her sister, but now she has her own room.
